entry.title: WTF is this post talking about?
entry.content: OK. FFFFF**k!è¿™ä¸€ç¯‡æ˜¯å¤§ä½¬ã€ŠRenyi DPã€‹çš„å‚è€ƒæ–‡çŒ®5ï¼Œè¯´æ˜¯æä¾›äº†æ›´ç”ŸåŠ¨çš„æ¯”å–»ï¼Ÿä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆçœ‹ä¸æ‡‚äººå®¶ç”ŸåŠ¨çš„æ¯”å–»ã€‚ã€‚äº‹å®žä¸Šã€ŠRDPã€‹è¿™ç¯‡åœ¨ç¬¬äºŒéƒ¨åˆ†ä»‹ç»DPçš„æ—¶å€™å°±ä¸çŸ¥æ€Žä¹ˆæ²¡å¤´æ²¡å°¾çš„å†’å‡ºä¸¤ç§åœºæ™¯ã€‚ã€‚å¤§ä½¬æ˜¯è¿™ä¹ˆå†™çš„ â€¦ We conclude that $(\epsilon,\delta)$-DP is a qualitatively different definition than pure $\epsilon$-DP (unless, of course, $\delta=0$, which we assume not to be the case through the rest of this section).ç„¶åŽä¸‹ä¸€æ®µæ˜¯è¿™æ ·çš„å¼€å¤´ Even for the simple case of exactly two input databases (such as when the adversary knows the entire dataset except whether it contains a particular record), the $\delta$ additive term encompasses two very different modes in which privacy may fail. In both scenarios $\epsilon$-DP holds with probability $1-\delta$, they differ in what happens with the remaining probability $\delta$â€¦.è¿™æ˜¯å“ªä¸¤ç§åœºæ™¯å•Šï¼ŒæŽ¥ç€å¾€ä¸‹å°±æ˜¯ä¸€ç§ä¼šä½¿privacy degrades gracefullyï¼Œä¾‹å­ï¼š$\epsilon_1$-DP with probability $\delta/2$, $\epsilon_2$-DP with P $\delta/4$â€¦;å¦ä¸€ç§æ˜¯ç›´æŽ¥ä»¥$\delta$çš„æ¦‚çŽ‡æ³„éœ²æŸæ¡è®°å½•æ˜¯å¦ä¸ºæ•°æ®åº“çš„ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ† â€“ becomes completely exposed.ç”¨æˆ‘ä»¬ç­åŒå­¦ç§‘å­¦å®¶çš„è¯æ¥è¯´å°±æ˜¯â€œæ”¾ä»€ä¹ˆå±â€ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯ç§‘å­¦å®¶åº”è¯¥ä¸ä¼šåœ¨çœ‹è®ºæ–‡çš„æ—¶å€™äº§ç”Ÿè¿™ç§ç–‘é—®å§ã€‚ã€‚è¿™ç§ä¸œè¥¿çœ‹ä¸æ‡‚ï¼Œçœ‹è¿™ç±»è®ºæ–‡ä¼¼ä¹Žå°±åƒçœ‹äº†ä¸€éæ–‡å­—ç„¶åŽå¹¶æ²¡æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆå®žè´¨æ€§çš„æ„Ÿè§‰ï¼Œæ‰£åŠå¤©å­—çœ¼åˆè®©æ•ˆçŽ‡å˜å¾—é¢‡ä½Žã€‚æ¶æ€§å¾ªçŽ¯æ¶æ€§å¾ªçŽ¯ã€‚ã€‚æ¢ä¸ªå‘å§T.T

entry.title: å·®åˆ†éšç§çš„ç»„åˆæ€§è´¨æ€»ç»“
entry.content: ä»Žè¿™æ¥çš„ï¼Œè®°å½•ä¸€ä¸‹ä½œä¸ºæ€»ç»“ï¼Œä¹‹å‰å„ç§surveyçœ‹çš„äº‘é‡Œé›¾é‡Œçš„ï¼Œæ€»ç®—æ‰¾åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ¸…æ™°çš„ã€‚ç»„åˆæ€§é¦–å…ˆæ˜¯pure DPçš„ç»„åˆæ€§ï¼Œæ‰€è°“pure DPå°±æ˜¯æŒ‡$\epsilon$-DPã€‚ å®šç†1 ($\epsilon$-DPçš„æ ‡å‡†ç»„åˆæ€§)ï¼šå¯¹äºŽ$1\leq i \leq k$ï¼Œå¦‚æžœ$M_i: \chi^n \rightarrow R_i$æ˜¯$\epsilon_i$-DPçš„ç®—æ³•ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆç»„åˆæ€§è¢«å®šä¹‰ä¸ºï¼Œ$M(D) = (M_1(D), M_2(D), \dots, M_k(D))$æ˜¯$\sum_{i=1}^k \epsilon_i$-DPçš„ã€‚ å®šç†2 ($(\epsilon,\delta)$-DPçš„æ ‡å‡†ç»„åˆæ€§)ï¼šå’Œå®šç†1ç±»ä¼¼ï¼Œå¯¹äºŽ$1\leq i \leq k$ï¼Œå¦‚æžœ$M_i: \chi^n \rightarrow R_i$æ˜¯$(\epsilon_i, \delta_i)$-DPçš„ç®—æ³•ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆç»„åˆæ€§è¢«å®šä¹‰ä¸ºï¼Œ$M(D) = (M_1(D), M_2(D), \dots, M_k(D))$æ˜¯$(\sum_{i=1}^k \epsilon_i, \sum_{i=1}^k \delta_i)$-DPçš„ã€‚ å®šç†3 (é«˜çº§ç»„åˆæ€§)ï¼šå¯¹äºŽ$1\leq i \leq k$å¹¶ä¸”$k < 1/\epsilon$ï¼Œ$\deltaâ€™>0$ï¼Œå¦‚æžœ$M_i: \chi^n \rightarrow R_i$æ˜¯$(\epsilon, \delta)$-DPçš„ç®—æ³•ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆç»„åˆæ€§è¢«å®šä¹‰ä¸ºï¼Œ$M(D) = (M_1(D), M_2(D), \dots, M_k(D))$æ˜¯$(O(\sqrt{2k\ln(1/\deltaâ€™)})\epsilon, k\delta + \deltaâ€™)$-DPçš„ã€‚ å¯ä»¥å›žç­”å¤šå°‘æŸ¥è¯¢ï¼ˆqueriesï¼‰ A single query Randomized Response Laplace Mechanism Exponential Mechanism Multiple queries Standard composition â€“ $\sqrt n$ queries Advanced composition â€“ $n$ queries é«˜æ–¯æœºåˆ¶å¤§æ¦‚æ˜¯å½“$\sigma = \frac{\sqrt{2\ln(1.25/\delta)}\Delta_2 f}{\epsilon}$æ—¶ï¼Œå¯¹å‡½æ•°$f$åŠ å…¥æœä»Žé«˜æ–¯åˆ†å¸ƒçš„å™ªå£° $nosie \sim N(0, \sigma^2)$ï¼Œå¯ä»¥æ»¡è¶³$(\epsilon, \delta)$-DP.$\delta$çš„ä½œç”¨ å½“ä½œDPå¤±è´¥çš„æ¦‚çŽ‡ï¼› åœ¨é«˜çº§ç»„åˆå®šç†ä¸­ï¼Œå½“ç»„åˆäº†nä¸ªæŸ¥è¯¢æ—¶ï¼Œå¯¹éšç§æˆæœ¬$\epsilon$çš„å¢žé•¿å¯ä»¥å¾—åˆ°æ›´å¥½çš„boundï¼› ç”¨æ¥å¯¹é«˜æ–¯æœºåˆ¶è¿›è¡Œåˆ†æžã€‚å…¶ä¸­ï¼Œ2å’Œ3æ˜¯æœ€åˆå¼•å…¥$(\epsilon, \delta)$-DPçš„åŠ¨æœºã€‚

entry.title: Random response in Rappor
entry.content: Rappor Introductionä¸­$2(Y-0.25)$çš„æŽ¨å¯¼åŽŸæ–‡[1]ä¸­ For this question, the survey respondent is asked to flip a fair coin, in secret, and answer â€œYesâ€ if it coms up heads, but tell the truth otherwise.åŽè¾¹è¯´è¿™ç§æƒ…å†µä¸‹å›žç­”è€…å¯ä»¥å¯¹â€œYesâ€è¿›è¡Œdenyï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æ— æ³•å¯¹â€œNoâ€è¿›è¡Œdenyï¼ŒäºŽæ˜¯ as a refinement, respondents can also choose the untruthful answer by flipping another coin in secret, and get strong deniability for both â€œYesâ€ and â€œNoâ€ answers.ç”±æ­¤æˆ‘ä»¬æŽ¨æµ‹è¿™ç§å›žç­”è¿‡ç¨‹æ˜¯ç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡æŠ›ç¡¬å¸æ—¶æ­£é¢å›žç­”â€œYesâ€ï¼Œåé¢çš„è¯ç¬¬äºŒæ¬¡æŠ›ç¡¬å¸ï¼›ç¬¬äºŒæ¬¡ç¡¬å¸åé¢çš„è¯å›žç­”â€œNoâ€ï¼Œæ­£é¢çš„è¯â€œtell the truthâ€ã€‚é‡‡ç”¨åƒ[2]ä¸­çš„è¡¨è¾¾å¼å­ï¼Œç”¨$Z=1$è¡¨ç¤ºå›žç­”çœŸçš„æ˜¯â€œYesâ€ï¼›ç”¨$Y=1$è¡¨ç¤ºå›žç­”æ˜¯ç»è¿‡RRåŽçš„â€œYesâ€ï¼ˆä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯è§‚å¯Ÿåˆ°çš„ç»“æžœï¼‰ï¼Œ$Y=0$è¡¨ç¤ºå›žç­”æ˜¯ç»è¿‡RRåŽçš„â€œNoâ€ã€‚äºŽæ˜¯æˆ‘ä»¬æœ‰ï¼šäºŽæ˜¯æ‰€ä»¥ä½†æ˜¯è¿™ä¸Žæ–‡ä¸­çš„ä¸ç¬¦ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥å¤§èƒ†æ£æµ‹æ–‡ä¸­çš„æ„æ€æ˜¯ï¼Œå¦‚æžœä¸¤æ¬¡éƒ½æ˜¯æ­£é¢å›žç­”â€Yesâ€ï¼›ä¸¤æ¬¡éƒ½æ˜¯åé¢å›žç­”â€œNoâ€ï¼›ä¸€æ­£ä¸€åå¦‚å®žå›žç­”ã€‚è¿™æ ·çš„è¯æ­¤æ—¶å¯ä»¥æŽ¨å‡º$P(Z=1)=2(P(Y=1)-0.25)$PS: å¯èƒ½æŽ¨å¯¼æœ‰é—®é¢˜ã€‚ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯æ²¡æƒ³å‡ºæ›´å¥½çš„è§£é‡Šã€‚å…¶å®žæ²¡å¿…è¦çº ç»“è¿™ä¸ªå°ç»†èŠ‚ï¼ŒçŸ¥é“RRçš„æ€æƒ³ï¼Œç„¶åŽèƒ½æ±‚å‡ºå‡†ç¡®çš„ç»“æžœå°±å¥½ã€‚RRçš„æ–¹å¼æ˜¯å¤šç§å¤šæ ·çš„ã€‚ã€‚PPS: 7.17æ—¥è¡¥å……ï¼Œå’Œè´µå“¥è®¨è®ºï¼Œç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡æ­£é¢æ—¶å›žç­”çœŸç›¸ï¼Œåé¢åˆ™å†æŠ›ä¸€æ¬¡ï¼›ç¬¬äºŒæ¬¡æ­£é¢åˆ™å›žç­”Yesï¼Œåé¢å›žç­”Noï¼Œä¹Ÿå¯æŽ¨å‡ºä¸Šè¿°ç»“è®ºã€‚å†æ¬¡è¯æ˜Žè¿™ä¸ªä¸æ˜¯é‡è¦é—®é¢˜ã€‚å‚è€ƒæ–‡çŒ®[1] RAPPOR: Randomized Aggregatable Privacy-Preserving Ordinal Response[2] Design and Analysis of the Randomized Response Technique

entry.content: Summaryç•¥å¾®ä½Žç«¯ï¼Œåªæ˜¯è®°å½• ubuntu14.04çŽ¯å¢ƒä¸‹çš„Rè¯­è¨€ä¸€ç§è‡ªç”±è½¯ä»¶ç¼–ç¨‹è¯­è¨€ä¸Žæ“ä½œçŽ¯å¢ƒï¼Œä¸»è¦ç”¨äºŽç»Ÿè®¡åˆ†æžã€ç»˜å›¾ã€æ•°æ®æŒ–æŽ˜ã€‚Ræœ¬æ¥æ˜¯ç”±æ¥è‡ªæ–°è¥¿å…°å¥¥å…‹å…°å¤§å­¦çš„ç½—æ–¯Â·ä¼Šå“ˆå¡å’Œç½—ä¼¯ç‰¹Â·æ°ç‰¹æ›¼å¼€å‘ï¼ˆä¹Ÿå› æ­¤ç§°ä¸ºRï¼‰ï¼ŒçŽ°åœ¨ç”±â€œRå¼€å‘æ ¸å¿ƒå›¢é˜Ÿâ€è´Ÿè´£å¼€å‘ã€‚RåŸºäºŽSè¯­è¨€çš„ä¸€ä¸ªGNUè®¡åˆ’é¡¹ç›®ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥å½“ä½œSè¯­è¨€çš„ä¸€ç§å®žçŽ°ï¼Œé€šå¸¸ç”¨Sè¯­è¨€ç¼–å†™çš„ä»£ç éƒ½å¯ä»¥ä¸ä½œä¿®æ”¹çš„åœ¨RçŽ¯å¢ƒä¸‹è¿è¡Œã€‚Rçš„è¯­æ³•æ˜¯æ¥è‡ªSchemeã€‚Installåœ¨â€/etc/apt/source.listâ€ä¸­æ·»åŠ deb https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/linux/ubuntu trustyæ‰§è¡Œ$ sudo apt-get updateé‡åˆ°é”™è¯¯W: GPG error: https://cloud.r-project.org trusty/ Release: The following signatures could not be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY 51716619E084DAB9æ‰§è¡Œå‘½ä»¤$ sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 51716619E084DAB9å®‰è£…å®Œå¤‡çš„ R ç³»ç»Ÿï¼š$ sudo apt-get install r-base

entry.title: FTRL online learning algorithm
entry.content: Summaryä¸¤ç§åœ¨çº¿å­¦ä¹ ç®—æ³•ï¼Œä¸€ç§æ˜¯Online Bayesian Learningï¼Œå¦ä¸€ç§æ˜¯FTRL(Follow The Regularized Leader)ã€‚æåˆ°FTRLå°±è¦å…ˆäº†è§£FTLï¼ŒFTLçš„æ€æƒ³æ˜¯æ¯æ¬¡æ‰¾åˆ°è®©ä¹‹å‰æ‰€æœ‰æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°ä¹‹å’Œæœ€å°çš„å‚æ•°ã€‚FTLæµç¨‹ï¼š åˆå§‹åŒ–$w$ for $t=1,\dots, n$ æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°$f_t$ æ›´æ–° è€ŒFTRLç®—æ³•å°±æ˜¯åœ¨FTLçš„ä¼˜åŒ–ç›®æ ‡çš„åŸºç¡€ä¸Šï¼ŒåŠ å…¥äº†æ­£åˆ™åŒ–é¡¹ï¼Œé˜²æ­¢è¿‡æ‹Ÿåˆï¼šFTRLç®—æ³•çš„æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°ï¼Œä¸€èˆ¬ä¹Ÿä¸æ˜¯èƒ½å¤Ÿå¾ˆå¿«æ±‚è§£çš„ï¼Œè¿™ç§æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œä¸€èˆ¬éœ€è¦æ‰¾ä¸€ä¸ªä»£ç†çš„æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°ã€‚ä»£ç†æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°éœ€è¦æ»¡è¶³å‡ ä¸ªè¦æ±‚ï¼š ä»£ç†æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°æ¯”è¾ƒå®¹æ˜“æ±‚è§£ï¼Œæœ€å¥½æ˜¯æœ‰è§£æžè§£ ä¼˜åŒ–ä»£ç†æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°æ±‚çš„è§£ï¼Œå’Œä¼˜åŒ–åŽŸå‡½æ•°å¾—åˆ°çš„è§£å·®è·ä¸èƒ½å¤ªå¤§ä¸ºäº†è¡¡é‡æ¡ä»¶2ä¸­çš„ä¸¤ä¸ªè§£çš„å·®è·ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œéœ€è¦å¼•å…¥regretçš„æ¦‚å¿µã€‚å‡è®¾æ¯ä¸€æ­¥ç”¨çš„ä»£ç†å‡½æ•°æ˜¯$h_t(w)$å…¶ä¸­$w^* = \mathop{argmin}\limits_{w} \sum_{i=1}^t f_i(w) $æ˜¯åŽŸå‡½æ•°çš„æœ€ä¼˜è§£ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥regretçš„å«ä¹‰å°±æ˜¯æ¯æ¬¡ä»£ç†å‡½æ•°æ±‚å‡ºè§£ï¼Œå’ŒçœŸæ­£æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°æ±‚å‡ºè§£çš„æŸå¤±å·®è·ã€‚è¿™ä¸ªæŸå¤±å¿…é¡»æ»¡è¶³ä¸€å®šæ¡ä»¶ï¼ŒOnline Learningæ‰å¯ä»¥æœ‰æ•ˆï¼šéšç€è®­ç»ƒæ ·æœ¬çš„å¢žå¤šï¼Œè¿™ä¸¤ä¸ªä¼˜åŒ–ç›®æ ‡ä¼˜åŒ–å‡ºçš„å‚æ•°çš„å®žé™…æŸå¤±å€¼å·®è·è¶Šæ¥è¶Šå°ã€‚å¦‚æžœ$f_t(w)$æ˜¯å‡¸å‡½æ•°ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥ç”¨å¦‚ä¸‹çš„ä»£ç†æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°ï¼šå…¶ä¸­$g_i$æ˜¯$f_i(w_i)$çš„æ¬¡æ¢¯åº¦ï¼ˆå¦‚æžœ$f_i(w_i)$æ˜¯å¯å¯¼çš„ï¼Œæ¬¡æ¢¯åº¦å°±æ˜¯æ¢¯åº¦ï¼‰ã€‚$\eta_t$æ»¡è¶³ï¼šåªè¦$f_i(w_i)$æ˜¯å‡¸å‡½æ•°ï¼Œä¸Šé¢çš„ä»£ç†å‡½æ•°ä¸€å®šæ»¡è¶³æ¡ä»¶(1)ã€‚ä¸Šé¢çš„å¼å­æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥å¾—å‡º$w$çš„è§£æžè§£ï¼šå…¶ä¸­â€” â€”whywhyå¯ä»¥å¾—åˆ°FTRLçš„æ›´æ–°æµç¨‹å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š è¾“å…¥$\alpha, \lambda_1$ åˆå§‹åŒ– $w_{1â€¦N}, z_{1â€¦N} = 0, n_{1â€¦N} = 0$ for $t = 1 â€¦ T$ æŸå¤±å‡½æ•° $f_t$ for $i = 1 â€¦N$ è®¡ç®— æ›´æ–° æœ€åŽä¸€ä¸ªå…¬å¼å“ªå„¿åŽ»äº†ã€‚PS: ä¸Šè¿°å†…å®¹æ•´ç†è‡ªç¾Žå›¢æŠ€æœ¯å›¢é˜Ÿçš„Online Learningç®—æ³•ç†è®ºä¸Žå®žè·µè€ï¼å­ï¼çœ‹ï¼çš„ï¼å¾ˆï¼æ™•ï¼

entry.title: MacOSä¸‹å®‰è£…ipdbçš„é—®é¢˜
entry.content: ä»¥ä¸‹æ–¹æ³•æ²¡æœ‰æµ‹è¯•ï¼š ç”±äºŽEl Capitanå¼•å…¥äº†SIPæœºåˆ¶(System Integrity Protection)ï¼Œé»˜è®¤ä¸‹ç³»ç»Ÿå¯ç”¨SIPç³»ç»Ÿå®Œæ•´æ€§ä¿æŠ¤æœºåˆ¶ï¼Œæ— è®ºæ˜¯å¯¹äºŽç¡¬ç›˜è¿˜æ˜¯è¿è¡Œæ—¶çš„è¿›ç¨‹é™åˆ¶å¯¹ç³»ç»Ÿç›®å½•çš„å†™æ“ä½œã€‚ è¿™ä¹Ÿæ˜¯æˆ‘ä»¬å®‰è£…ipdb/ipythonå¤±è´¥çš„åŽŸå› â€¦.çŽ°åœ¨çš„è§£å†³åŠžæ³•æ˜¯å–æ¶ˆSIPæœºåˆ¶ï¼Œå…·ä½“åšæ³•æ˜¯ï¼šé‡å¯ç”µè„‘ï¼ŒæŒ‰ä½Command+R(ç›´åˆ°å‡ºçŽ°è‹¹æžœæ ‡å¿—)è¿›å…¥Recovery Mode(æ¢å¤æ¨¡å¼)å·¦ä¸Šè§’èœå•é‡Œæ‰¾åˆ°å®žç”¨å·¥å…· -> ç»ˆç«¯è¾“å…¥csrutil disableå›žè½¦é‡å¯Macå³å¯å¦‚æžœæƒ³é‡æ–°å¯åŠ¨SIPæœºåˆ¶é‡å¤ä¸Šè¿°æ­¥éª¤æ”¹ç”¨csrutil enableå³å¯æˆ‘ä»¬çŽ°åœ¨å†çœ‹çœ‹sipçš„çŠ¶æ€, è¿™æ ·å†å®‰è£…ipdb/ipythonã€geventå†ä¹Ÿä¸ä¼šæç¤ºæ— æ³•å†™å…¥çš„æƒé™æç¤ºäº†$ csrutil statusSystem Integrity Protection status: disabled.å¦‚æžœåœ¨macä¸‹ç¢°åˆ°OSError: [Errno 1] Operation not permitted:çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå°±ç®—ç”¨sudo ä¹Ÿæ— æ³•è§£å†³ï¼Œé‚£è‚¯å®šæ˜¯sipåœ¨ä½œæ€ªäº†.æœ¬äººæµ‹è¯•äº†å¦ä¸€ç§æ›´ä¸ºä¼˜é›…çš„æ–¹æ³•ï¼ŒåŸºäºŽæ™®é€šç”¨æˆ·çš„æƒé™æ¥å®‰è£…ã€‚æ­¤å¤–ï¼Œæœ¬äººè¿˜é‡åˆ°äº†æç¤ºç‰ˆæœ¬çš„é—®é¢˜ã€‚error in ipdb setup command: Invalid environment marker: python_version >= "3.3"$ pip install ipdb==0.10.2 --user -U

entry.title: The first test blog
entry.content: Summary:Copy from one of my memos for test.catalog Module 2 Module 3 Module 4Module2$a^2_1$ åœ¨VLDB2016ä¸Šçš„ä¸€ä¸ªæ•™ç¨‹ä¸ºäº†ä¿è¯æ•°æ®çš„å¯ç”¨æ€§ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªç»Ÿè®¡æ•°æ®åº“å¿…é¡»è¦æ³„æ¼ä¸€äº›å…³äºŽä¸ªä½“çš„ä¿¡æ¯ A vast majority of records in a database of size n can be reconstructed when $n\log(n)^2$ queriesare answered by a statistical database â€¦â€¦ even if each answer has been arbitrarilyaltered to have up to o(âˆšn) errorâ€”â€”â€” Dinur-Nissim PODS 2003ä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯è¯´ï¼Œå¯¹äºŽï¼ˆåœ¨åŒä¸€ä¸ªæ•°æ®åº“ä¸Šçš„ï¼‰queriesçš„æ•°é‡æ˜¯æœ‰é™åˆ¶çš„ã€‚Module 3å¯¹äºŽè¡¨æ ¼å¼çš„æ•°æ®åº“æŸ¥è¯¢çš„å›žå¤Offline (batch) Entire W given as input, answers computed in batchOnline (adaptive) W is sequence q1, q2, â€¦ that arrives online Adaptive: analystâ€™s choice for qi can depend onanswers ð‘Ž1, â€¦ , ð‘Žð‘–âˆ’1Answering linear queries online is strictly harder than answering them offline [BSU16]æ•°æ®å¤æ‚æ€§å’ŒæŸ¥è¯¢çš„å¤æ‚æ€§Queryï¼š histograms, range queries, marginals, counting queries, linear queriesSolution variants: query answers vs.synthetic dataTwo high-level approaches to solving problem Direct:â€“ Output of the algorithm is list of query answers Synthetic data:â€“ Algorithm constructs a synthetic dataset Dâ€™, which canbe queried directly by analystâ€“ Analyst can pose additional queries on Dâ€™(though answers may not be accurate)

entry.title: Markdown Extra Components
entry.content: Summary:You can pick as item to see how to apply in markdown.Especial Elements Evidence Side-by-Side Star Especial Breaker SpoilerExternal Elements Gist Codepen Slideshare VideosEvidenceYou can try the evidence!Paragraphs can be written like so. A paragraph is the basic block of Markdown. A paragraph is what text will turn into when there is no reason it should become anything else.<span class="evidence">Paragraphs can be written like so. A paragraph is the basic block of Markdown. A paragraph is what text will turn into when there is no reason it should become anything else.</span>Side-by-sideLike the Medium component.Image on the left and Text on the right:<div class="side-by-side"> <div class="toleft"> <img class="image" src="http://localhost:4000/" alt="Alt Text"> <figcaption class="caption">Test photo by Sun</figcaption> </div> <div class="toright"> <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.</p> </div></div> Test photo by Sun Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum. Text on the left and Image on the right:<div class="side-by-side"> <div class="toleft"> <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.</p> </div> <div class="toright"> <img class="image" src="http://localhost:4000/" alt="Alt Text"> <figcaption class="caption">Test photo by Sun</figcaption> </div></div> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum. Test photo by Sun StarYou can give evidence to a post. Just add the tag to the markdown file.star: trueEspecial BreakerYou can add a especial hr to your text.<div class="breaker"></div>SpoilerYou can add an especial hidden content that appears on hover.<div class="spoiler"><p>your content</p></div>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.GistYou can add Gists from github.{ % gist sergiokopplin/91ff4220480727b47224245ee2e9c291 % }CodepenYou can add Pens from Codepen.<p data-height="268" data-theme-id="0" data-slug-hash="gfdDu" data-default-tab="result" data-user="chriscoyier" class='codepen'> See the Pen <a href='http://codepen.io/chriscoyier/pen/gfdDu/'>Crappy Recreation of the Book Cover of *The Flame Alphabet*</a> by Chris Coyier (<a href='http://codepen.io/chriscoyier'>@chriscoyier</a>) on <a href='http://codepen.io'>CodePen</a>.</p><script async src="//assets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script>See the Pen Crappy Recreation of the Book Cover of *The Flame Alphabet* by Chris Coyier (@chriscoyier) on CodePen.SlideshareAdd your presentations here!<iframe src="//www.slideshare.net/slideshow/embed_code/key/hqDhSJoWkrHe7l" width="560" height="310" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" scrolling="no" style="border:1px solid #CCC; border-width:1px; margin-bottom:5px; max-width: 100%;" allowfullscreen> </iframe> VideosDo you want some videos? Youtube, Vimeo or Vevo? Copy the embed code and paste on your post!Example<iframe width="560" height="310" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/r7XhWUDj-Ts" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

entry.title: Markdown Common Elements
entry.content: Summary:You can pick as item to see how to apply in markdown.Comum Elements Basic formatting Headings Lists Paragraph Modifiers Urls Horizontal Rule Images CodeBasic formattingThis note demonstrates some of what Markdown is capable of doing.And thatâ€™s how to do it.This note **demonstrates** some of what [Markdown][some/link] is *capable of doing*.HeadingsThere are six levels of headings. They correspond with the six levels of HTML headings. Youâ€™ve probably noticed them already in the page. Each level down uses one more hash character. But we are using just 4 of them.Headings can be smallHeadings can be smallHeadings can be smallHeadings can be small# Heading## Heading### Heading#### HeadingListsOrdered list Item 1 A second item Number 31. Item 12. A second item3. Number 3Unordered list An item Another item Yet another item And thereâ€™s moreâ€¦* An item* Another item* Yet another item* And there's more...Paragraph modifiersQuote Here is a quote. What this is should be self explanatory. Quotes are automatically indented when they are used.> Here is a quote. What this is should be self explanatory.URLsURLs can be made in a handful of ways: A named link to Mark It Down. Another named link to Mark It Down Sometimes you just want a URL like http://markitdown.net/.* A named link to [MarkItDown][3].* Another named link to [MarkItDown](http://markitdown.net/)* Sometimes you just want a URL like <http://markitdown.net/>.Horizontal ruleA horizontal rule is a line that goes across the middle of the page.Itâ€™s sometimes handy for breaking things up.---ImagesMarkdown can also contain images. Iâ€™ll need to add something here sometime.![Markdowm Image][/image/url]Figure Caption?![Markdowm Image][/image/url]<figcaption class="caption">Photo by John Doe</figcaption>Photo by John DoeBigger Images?![Markdowm Image][/image/url]{: class="bigger-image" }CodeA HTML Example:<!DOCTYPE html><html lang="en"><head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <title>Document</title></head><body> <h1>Just a test</h1></body></html>A CSS Example:pre { padding: 10px; font-size: .8em; white-space: pre;}pre, table { width: 100%;}code, pre, tt { font-family: Monaco, Consolas, Inconsolata, monospace, sans-serif; background: rgba(0,0,0,.05);}A JS Example:// Sticky Header$(window).scroll(function() { if ($(window).scrollTop() > 900 && !$("body").hasClass('show-menu')) { $('#hamburguer__open').fadeOut('fast'); } else if (!$("body").hasClass('show-menu')) { $('#hamburguer__open').fadeIn('fast'); }});

entry.title: :ramen: Indigo, minimalist jekyll theme
entry.content: Example of project - Indigo Minimalist Jekyll Template - Demo. This is a simple and minimalist template for Jekyll for those who likes to eat noodles.What has inside? Gulp BrowserSync Stylus SVG Travis No JS 98/100Check it out here.If you need some help, just tell me.
